alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 4:08PM MDT until August 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 408 PM MDT, News media reported producing flash flooding in Rociada. Earlier, up to 1.2 inches of rain fell over Manuelitas Creek and the Sapello River. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tierra Monte, Gascon, Sapello, Rociada, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County and Manuelitas. This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 12 and 13. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
